metadata.Title: CVE-2020-24586 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: The 802.11 standard that underpins Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA, WPA2, andWPA3) and Wired Equivalent Privacy (WEP) doesn't require that receivedfragments be cleared from memory after (re)connecting to a network. Underthe right circumstances, when another device sends fragmented framesencrypted using WEP, CCMP, or GCMP, this can be abused to inject arbitrarynetwork packets and/or exfiltrate user data.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
